snippet: Consumers were buying less than retailers had expected, and stores had to mark down inventory to get it out the door by Christmas.
abstract: Thomson Reuters reports sales at stores open at least a year at major retail chains rose 3.4 percent in December 2011 compared with December 2010; consumers bought less than retailers expected, and stores had to mark down inventory to sell it by Christmas.
